name: AI-Powered Meal Planner
description: AI meal planner suggests recipes based on user preferences and history.

current_prd.elevator_pitch: Our AI-Powered Meal Planner automates meal planning by intelligently suggesting recipes tailored to your unique preferences and past choices, saving you time and stress while ensuring delicious, personalized meals every day.
current_prd.problem_statement: Users struggle with the time-consuming and often repetitive task of meal planning, leading to decision fatigue, uninspired meals, and difficulty adhering to dietary goals. Existing solutions often lack true personalization and automation.
current_prd.solution: The AI-Powered Meal Planner leverages machine learning to analyze user preferences, dietary restrictions, and historical meal choices to generate highly personalized and automated meal plans, reducing planning effort and increasing meal satisfaction.

key_features.feature_description: Suggests recipes based on user preferences, dietary needs, and past meal choices using machine learning algorithms.
Allows users to input and manage their dietary restrictions, allergies, and food preferences.
Generates weekly or daily meal plans automatically based on recommendations and user input.
Provides a comprehensive database of recipes with nutritional information, cooking instructions, and ingredient lists.
Allows users to manually adjust or swap recipes within their generated meal plan.
Generates a shopping list based on the ingredients required for the planned meals.
Allows users to rate recipes and provide feedback, which further refines AI recommendations.
API for integrating with third-party grocery delivery services.
Scalable backend infrastructure to handle a growing user base and recipe database.
Secure handling of user data, including preferences and dietary information.
Dashboard for administrators to manage users, recipes, and monitor system performance.
Tools for managing user accounts, resetting passwords, and handling support requests.
Reporting on user engagement, popular recipes, and system usage patterns.
Monitoring of system health, performance, and error logging.
Automated deployment pipelines and tools for continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD).
Tools and processes for ongoing maintenance, updates, and technical support.

steps: User downloads and opens the app.
User creates an account or logs in.
User is prompted to set up their dietary preferences (allergies, restrictions, cuisine types, disliked ingredients).
User confirms preferences, and the system saves them to their profile.
User navigates to the 'Meal Plan' section.
User selects desired meal plan duration (e.g., 3 days, 1 week).
System retrieves user preferences and historical data.
AI Recommendation Engine generates a personalized meal plan.
System displays the generated meal plan to the user.
User views their generated meal plan.
User taps on a specific meal to view recipe details.
User taps 'Swap Recipe' button.
System suggests alternative recipes based on preferences.
User selects a new recipe, and the system updates the meal plan.
user_flows.flow_name: Meal Plan Customization and Recipe Swap

steps: User finalizes their meal plan.
User taps 'Generate Shopping List'.
System compiles a list of ingredients from all planned meals.
User can view, edit, and mark items as purchased.
User can optionally send the list to a grocery delivery service via integration.
User completes a meal from their plan.
User is prompted to rate the recipe (e.g., 1-5 stars).
User can optionally provide text feedback.
System records the rating and feedback.
AI Recommendation Engine uses this data to refine future suggestions for the user.
user_flows.flow_name: Recipe Rating and AI Feedback Loop

steps: Admin logs into the Admin Dashboard.
Admin navigates to the 'User Management' section.
Admin can view a list of all users.
Admin can search for specific users, view their profiles, reset passwords, or suspend accounts.
Admin can access user support requests and manage them.
Admin logs into the Admin Dashboard.
Admin navigates to the 'Recipe Management' section.
Admin can view, add, edit, or delete recipes in the database.
Admin can update nutritional information, ingredients, and cooking instructions.
Admin can approve or reject user-submitted recipes (if applicable).
Technical Operations team accesses the System Monitoring dashboard.
Team monitors real-time metrics such as server load, API response times, and database performance.
Automated alerts are triggered for anomalies or critical issues.
Team investigates and resolves performance bottlenecks or errors.
Logs are reviewed for detailed error analysis and debugging.
Analytics team accesses the Analytics and Reporting dashboard.
Team generates reports on key metrics like user engagement, most popular recipes, and feature usage.
Reports are used to identify trends, user behavior patterns, and areas for improvement.
Data insights inform product development and marketing strategies.
Regular reports are scheduled and distributed to relevant stakeholders.

current_prd.success_metrics: Increase user retention by 20% within the first year. Achieve a 90% user satisfaction rate with meal plan recommendations. Reduce time spent on meal planning by users by an average of 50%. Grow active user base to 100,000 within 18 months. Maintain system uptime of 99.9%.
current_prd.competitors: PlateJoy, Paprika, Mealime, Yummly, BigOven, eMeals, Forks Over Knives, MyFitnessPal (meal tracking features).
current_prd.vision: To become the leading AI-powered platform for personalized nutrition and meal management, empowering individuals to achieve their health and wellness goals effortlessly through intelligent, adaptive, and enjoyable food experiences.

target_audience.name: Busy Professionals
target_audience.pain_points: Lack of time for meal prep, difficulty finding diverse and healthy recipes, repetitive meals, stress over daily meal decisions.
target_audience.demographics: Ages 25-55, urban/suburban, tech-savvy, working full-time, often with families.
target_audience.needs_and_goals: Save time on meal planning and grocery shopping, eat healthier, reduce decision fatigue, find quick and easy recipes.

target_audience.name: Health-Conscious Individuals
target_audience.pain_points: Difficulty finding recipes that fit strict dietary requirements, manual tracking of nutrition, lack of variety in healthy meals, feeling overwhelmed by meal prep for specific diets.
target_audience.demographics: Ages 18-65, varied locations, actively pursuing specific health or fitness goals (weight loss, muscle gain, managing dietary conditions).
target_audience.needs_and_goals: Adhere to specific dietary plans (keto, vegan, gluten-free), track macros/calories, discover healthy and nutritious recipes, maintain a balanced diet.

phasing.rationale: This phase establishes the core value proposition: personalized, automated meal planning. It's a strong demo-able product that showcases the AI and basic user interaction, allowing stakeholders to see the primary functionality.

This phase adds critical features for user engagement (rating/feedback) and practical utility (shopping list), while also ensuring the foundational infrastructure and security are in place for a public beta launch to early users.
phasing.phase_name: Beta Launch with Enhanced User Experience

phasing.rationale: This phase focuses on integrating external services for enhanced user convenience and establishing robust internal tools for managing the product, users, and system health. These features are crucial for a full commercial launch and ongoing, scalable operations.

current_prd.design_principles: Personalization: Tailored experiences based on user data. Simplicity: Intuitive and easy-to-use interface. Efficiency: Streamlined workflows for meal planning and grocery shopping. Adaptability: Responsive design for various devices. Feedback-driven: Continuous improvement through user ratings and preferences.

user_personas.name: Sarah, The Busy Professional
user_personas.goals: Quickly generate healthy meal plans, save time on grocery shopping, reduce decision fatigue.
user_personas.pain_points: Lack of time for meal prep, repetitive meals, difficulty finding diverse and healthy recipes.

user_personas.name: David, The Health-Conscious Individual
user_personas.goals: Adhere to specific dietary plans (e.g., keto, high-protein), track macros, discover new healthy recipes.
user_personas.pain_points: Difficulty finding recipes that fit strict dietary requirements, manual tracking of nutrition, lack of variety in healthy meals.

steps.description: Opens the app and navigates to the 'Meal Plan' section.
Displays options for meal plan duration (e.g., 3 days, 1 week).
AI generates a personalized weekly meal plan based on Sarah's preferences and historical data.
Reviews the generated meal plan and makes minor adjustments.

user_journeys.context: Sarah wants to generate a weekly meal plan.
user_journeys.trigger: Sarah realizes she needs to plan meals for the upcoming week.

steps.description: Displays a list of matching recipes.
Browses recipes and selects one to view details.
Shows recipe ingredients, instructions, and nutritional information.

user_journeys.context: David needs to find a high-protein, gluten-free dinner recipe.
user_journeys.trigger: David is looking for a specific type of recipe for dinner.

current_prd.sitemap:
Home/Dashboard
  - Quick overview of today's meals, upcoming plan, and quick actions.
Meal Plan
  - View daily/weekly meal plans.
  - Customize/Swap recipes.
  - Generate shopping list.
Recipes
  - Browse/Search recipes.
  - Filter by dietary needs, cuisine, ingredients.
  - View recipe details (ingredients, instructions, nutrition).
  - Rate recipes.
Shopping List
  - View generated shopping list.
  - Edit/Mark items.
  - Integrate with grocery delivery.
Profile/Settings
  - Manage dietary preferences.
  - Account settings (password, notifications).
  - Feedback/Support.
Onboarding
  - Account creation/Login.
  - Initial preference setup.
current_prd.navigation_design:
Global Navigation (Persistent):
  - Bottom Tab Bar (Mobile): Home, Meal Plan, Recipes, Shopping List, Profile.
  - Sidebar Navigation (Desktop/Tablet): Home, Meal Plan, Recipes, Shopping List, Profile.
Contextual Navigation:
  - Back buttons: Standard back navigation within flows.
  - Filters/Sort: Within Recipes and Shopping List sections.
  - Action Buttons: Prominent CTAs for 'Generate Meal Plan', 'Add to Shopping List', 'Swap Recipe'.
Breadcrumbs:
  - For deeper navigation paths (e.g., Recipes > Italian > Pasta Carbonara).

rows.value: Classic lasagna with layers of pasta, rich tomato sauce, ricotta, and spinach.
1. Preheat oven to 375F. 2. Cook lasagna noodles. 3. Prepare sauce. 4. Layer ingredients. 5. Bake for 30 mins.
Quick and healthy stir-fry with chicken and mixed vegetables, served with rice.
1. Marinate chicken. 2. Chop vegetables. 3. Stir-fry chicken. 4. Add vegetables and sauce. 5. Serve with rice.
Good, but a bit too spicy for my taste.

current_prd.mermaid_erd_diagram:
erDiagram
  USER ||--o{ MEAL_PLAN : creates
  USER ||--o{ USER_PREFERENCE : sets
  USER ||--o{ RATING : provides
  USER ||--o{ SHOPPING_LIST_ITEM : has
  MEAL_PLAN ||--o{ MEAL_PLAN_ITEM : contains
  MEAL_PLAN_ITEM ||--|| RECIPE : includes
  RECIPE ||--o{ RECIPE_INGREDIENT : uses
  INGREDIENT ||--o{ RECIPE_INGREDIENT : is_part_of
  RECIPE ||--o{ RATING : receives

  USER {
    INT id
    VARCHAR email
    VARCHAR password_hash
    VARCHAR name
  }
  USER_PREFERENCE {
    INT id
    INT user_id
    VARCHAR preference_type
    VARCHAR preference_value
  }
  RECIPE {
    INT id
    VARCHAR name
    TEXT description
    TEXT instructions
    FLOAT prep_time_minutes
    FLOAT cook_time_minutes
    INT servings
    VARCHAR cuisine_type
    VARCHAR meal_type
    TEXT nutritional_info
  }
  INGREDIENT {
    INT id
    VARCHAR name
    VARCHAR unit
  }
  RECIPE_INGREDIENT {
    INT id
    INT recipe_id
    INT ingredient_id
    FLOAT quantity
  }
  MEAL_PLAN {
    INT id
    INT user_id
    TIMESTAMP start_date
    TIMESTAMP end_date
    VARCHAR plan_name
  }
  MEAL_PLAN_ITEM {
    INT id
    INT meal_plan_id
    INT recipe_id
    TIMESTAMP scheduled_date
    VARCHAR meal_type
  }
  RATING {
    INT id
    INT user_id
    INT recipe_id
    INT score
    TEXT feedback
    TIMESTAMP created_at
  }
  SHOPPING_LIST_ITEM {
    INT id
    INT user_id
    INT ingredient_id
    FLOAT quantity
    VARCHAR unit
    BOOLEAN is_purchased
  }

user_stories.title: Personalized Recipe Recommendations

user_story.as_a: user with specific dietary needs and preferences
user_story.i_want: to receive recipe suggestions tailored to my profile and past choices
user_story.so_that: I can easily discover new meals that I will enjoy and that fit my lifestyle

acceptance_criteria: The system recommends recipes based on my saved dietary restrictions and allergies.
The system considers my preferred cuisine types and disliked ingredients.
The system learns from my past meal choices and ratings to refine future recommendations.
I can view why a particular recipe was recommended.

user_stories.title: Manage User Dietary Preferences

user_story.i_want: to easily set up and manage my dietary restrictions, allergies, and food preferences
user_story.so_that: the app can provide accurate and safe meal suggestions

acceptance_criteria: I can input and save my dietary restrictions (e.g., vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free).
I can list specific food allergies (e.g., peanuts, shellfish).
I can select preferred cuisine types (e.g., Italian, Mexican, Asian).
I can add ingredients I dislike or want to avoid.
I can update my preferences at any time.

user_stories.title: Automated Meal Plan Generation

user_story.i_want: to have a personalized meal plan automatically generated for me
user_story.so_that: I can save time and reduce the effort of daily meal planning

acceptance_criteria: I can select a duration for my meal plan (e.g., 3 days, 1 week).
The system automatically generates a meal plan based on my preferences and AI recommendations.
The generated meal plan includes breakfast, lunch, and dinner for each day.
I can view a summary of the meal plan before confirming.

user_stories.title: Access Recipe Database

user_story.i_want: to access a wide variety of recipes with detailed information
user_story.so_that: I can easily find and prepare meals that fit my needs

acceptance_criteria: I can browse a comprehensive database of recipes.
Each recipe displays nutritional information (calories, macros).
Each recipe includes clear cooking instructions.
Each recipe lists all necessary ingredients with quantities.
I can search for recipes by keywords, ingredients, or cuisine type.

user_stories.title: Customize Meal Plan

user_story.i_want: to be able to customize and adjust my generated meal plan
user_story.so_that: I can ensure the plan perfectly matches my preferences and daily needs

acceptance_criteria: I can view my generated meal plan for the selected duration.
I can tap on any meal slot to see alternative recipe suggestions.
The suggested alternatives adhere to my dietary preferences.
I can swap a recipe in my meal plan with a suggested alternative.
I can manually add a recipe from the database to an empty meal slot.

user_stories.title: Generate Automated Shopping List

user_story.i_want: to have an automated shopping list generated from my plan
user_story.so_that: I can efficiently buy groceries without forgetting anything

acceptance_criteria: The system automatically generates a shopping list based on all ingredients in my finalized meal plan.
The shopping list groups ingredients by category (e.g., produce, dairy, pantry).
I can view the shopping list within the app.
I can manually add or remove items from the shopping list.
I can mark items as purchased.

user_stories.title: Rate Recipes and Provide Feedback

user_story.as_a: user who wants to improve recommendations
user_story.i_want: to rate recipes and provide feedback
user_story.so_that: the AI can learn my preferences better and offer more accurate suggestions

acceptance_criteria: After preparing a meal, I am prompted to rate the recipe.
I can rate recipes on a scale (e.g., 1-5 stars).
I can optionally provide free-text feedback about the recipe.
My ratings and feedback are used by the AI to improve future recommendations for me.
I can view my past ratings and feedback.

user_stories.title: Integrate with Grocery Delivery Services

user_story.i_want: to seamlessly send my shopping list to a grocery delivery service
user_story.so_that: I can save even more time by automating my grocery purchases

acceptance_criteria: I can connect my shopping list to supported third-party grocery delivery services.
I can send my finalized shopping list directly to the chosen grocery delivery service.
I receive confirmation that my order has been placed with the grocery delivery service.
The integration handles potential discrepancies in ingredient availability or pricing.

user_stories.title: Scalable Backend Infrastructure

user_story.i_want: to have a scalable backend infrastructure
user_story.so_that: the application can support a growing user base and data volume without performance issues

acceptance_criteria: The backend infrastructure can handle a growing number of active users without performance degradation.
The recipe database can scale to accommodate a large and expanding collection of recipes.
The AI recommendation engine can process increasing amounts of user data and recipe information efficiently.
The system maintains high availability and responsiveness during peak usage times.

user_stories.title: Ensure Data Security and Privacy

user_story.as_a: user of the meal planner app
user_story.i_want: my personal and dietary data to be secure and private
user_story.so_that: I can trust the app with my sensitive information

acceptance_criteria: All user personal data, including preferences and dietary information, is encrypted at rest and in transit.
The system complies with relevant data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).
Users have control over their data and can request access, modification, or deletion.
Access to sensitive user data is restricted to authorized personnel only.
Regular security audits are conducted to identify and address vulnerabilities.

user_stories.title: Administer User Accounts

user_story.as_a: administrator of the meal planner app
user_story.i_want: to have a dashboard to manage user accounts
user_story.so_that: I can provide support, maintain data integrity, and ensure a smooth user experience

acceptance_criteria: As an admin, I can log into a secure dashboard.
I can view a list of all registered users and their basic information.
I can search for specific users by name or email.
I can reset user passwords.
I can suspend or reactivate user accounts.
I can access and manage user support requests.

user_stories.title: Manage Recipe Database (Admin)

user_story.as_a: administrator of the meal planner app
user_story.so_that: I can ensure the quality, accuracy, and breadth of available recipes

acceptance_criteria: As an admin, I can access a section to manage the recipe database.
I can add new recipes, including ingredients, instructions, and nutritional information.
I can edit existing recipes to update details or correct errors.
I can delete recipes from the database.
I can approve or reject user-submitted recipes (if applicable).

user_stories.title: Monitor Analytics and Generate Reports

user_story.i_want: to access comprehensive analytics and reporting tools
user_story.so_that: I can understand user behavior, identify trends, and inform product improvements

acceptance_criteria: As an analytics team member, I can access a dashboard displaying key performance indicators (KPIs).
I can generate reports on user engagement (e.g., daily active users, session duration).
I can view data on the most popular recipes and meal plans.
I can analyze user behavior patterns and feature usage.
I can export reports for further analysis and stakeholder presentations.

user_stories.title: Monitor System Health and Log Errors

user_story.i_want: to have robust system monitoring and error logging capabilities
user_story.so_that: I can proactively identify and resolve issues to ensure application stability and performance

acceptance_criteria: As a technical operations team member, I can monitor real-time system health and performance metrics.
I receive automated alerts for critical issues or performance anomalies.
I can access detailed error logs for debugging and troubleshooting.
The monitoring system provides insights into API response times, server load, and database performance.
I can track system uptime and availability.

user_stories.title: Automated Deployment and CI/CD

user_story.i_want: to have automated deployment and CI/CD tools
user_story.so_that: we can deliver new features and updates rapidly and reliably

acceptance_criteria: As a development team, we have automated pipelines for building, testing, and deploying the application.
New code changes are automatically integrated and tested upon submission.
We can deploy new versions of the application quickly and reliably.
Rollback mechanisms are in place for failed deployments.
The CI/CD pipeline ensures consistent environments across development, staging, and production.

user_stories.title: Maintenance and Support Tools

user_story.i_want: to have effective maintenance and support tools
user_story.so_that: we can provide timely assistance to users and keep the application running smoothly

acceptance_criteria: As a technical support team, we have tools to diagnose and resolve user issues efficiently.
We can access user-specific data (with appropriate privacy controls) to assist with troubleshooting.
We have a knowledge base or documentation for common issues and their resolutions.
We can apply patches or updates to the system without significant downtime.
We have a process for collecting and acting on user feedback and bug reports.

current_prd.tam_description: Total Addressable Market for the Global Digital Health and Wellness Market, encompassing all digital solutions for health, fitness, nutrition, and overall well-being, including mobile apps, wearable tech, and online platforms.
current_prd.tam_estimation_basis: Based on the overall market size for digital health and wellness solutions globally, which includes a wide array of applications from fitness tracking to nutrition and meal management.
current_prd.tam_source: Hypothetical: Statista Global Digital Health Market Report 2023, Grand View Research Digital Wellness Market Analysis.
current_prd.sam_description: Serviceable Available Market for Digital Nutrition and Meal Planning Solutions, representing the segment of the digital health market focused on meal planning, recipe recommendations, and dietary management for individuals seeking personalized and automated food solutions.
current_prd.sam_estimation_basis: Estimated 10 percent of the broader Global Digital Health and Wellness Market, specifically targeting the segment of users actively seeking digital solutions for nutrition, meal planning, and dietary management.
current_prd.sam_source: Hypothetical: Market research on nutrition and meal planning app adoption, user surveys on digital diet management trends.
current_prd.som_description: Serviceable Obtainable Market for AI-Powered Personalized Meal Planning, representing the realistic market share our product can capture within the Serviceable Available Market over a 5-year horizon, leveraging its unique AI-driven personalization and automation capabilities amidst existing competition.
current_prd.som_estimation_basis: Conservative 2 percent market share estimate over 5 years within the SAM, considering the competitive landscape but capitalizing on the product's advanced AI personalization and automation as a key differentiator.
current_prd.som_source: Hypothetical: Competitive analysis of existing meal planning apps, new market entry success rates in health tech, and projected adoption rates for AI-enhanced solutions.
current_prd.advantage_summary: AI-powered personalization and automation of meal planning, tailored recipe suggestions, time-saving, stress reduction, and enhanced adherence to dietary goals through intelligent, adaptive food experiences.

planned.model_content:
class UserPreference < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :user

  rhino_owner :user
  rhino_references [:user]
end
planned.migration_content:
class CreateUserPreferences < ActiveRecord::Migration[7.2]
  def change
    create_table :user_preferences do |t|
      t.references :user, null: false, foreign_key: true
      t.string :preference_type, null: false
      t.string :preference_value, null: false

      t.timestamps
    end
    add_index :user_preferences, [:user_id, :preference_type], unique: true
  end
end
planned.rails_model_generation_command_line: rails generate model UserPreference user:references preference_type:string preference_value:string

planned.model_content:
class Recipe < ApplicationRecord
  belongs_to :organization
  has_many :meal_plan_items, dependent: :destroy
  has_many :recipe_ingredients, dependent: :destroy
  has_many :ratings, dependent: :destroy
